lead_paragraph: The Saints’ visions of a return to the N.F.C. title game seem like a distant memory after a season that has included a four-game winning streak and a four-game losing streak. The Saints’ latest loss is the all-purpose star Reggie Bush, who is out with a knee injury, but Drew Brees has enough options to cover for him. Three is the magic number for the Falcons, as in three wins, three years since their last playofff berth and three starting quarterbacks. Chris Redman will replace Joey Harrington, who has been benched — you guessed it — three times in 12 games. The good news? After tonight, only three games remain in the Falcons’ season. ANDREW DAS.
